intro: Psychotria lycioides, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareca," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. It has a woody stem and produces small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. Due to its medicinal and psychoactive properties, it has been historically used by indigenous communities for various purposes.
